column4: when i get music from the internet, how can i play it on ubuntu ?
rhythmbox
just try it out, its easy
it comes preinstalled with ubuntu
there is also vlc for linux
just install via software center
in applications menu the lowest entry
you might also need ubuntu restricted extras, also from software center
its required to play mp3 and some closed formats
just use the search field to find ubuntu restricted extras and vlc
what shall i search for
vlc ad ubuntu restricted extras

it does, im listening to mp3 right now ;) all you need is to install that restricted extras package, then all programs who support mp3 can play it. it just isnt being shipped with ubuntu because of legal restrictions so you have to install it before you can listen to mp3s
that command does the same as installing restricted extras via the software center.
why do you want to stream it? i thought u want to listen to mp3 files
do you want to convert a cd to mp3 files or what?
just open the file like any other file, the default program will open and play it. you can open it with other programs by right clicking
just open the file with vlc
is the volume bar near the clock up?
did you install ubuntu restricted extras
did you try right clicking the file and choosing vlc?
